definitions: Stringent laws, rules, or conditions are very severe or are strictly controlled.
Stringent financial conditions are difficult and strictly controlled because there is not much money.
requiring strict attention to rules, procedure, detail, etc
characterized by or causing a shortage of credit, loan capital, etc
rigidly controlled, enforced, etc.; strict; severe
tight in loan or investment money
rigorously binding or exacting; strict; severe
characterized by a shortage in money for loan or investment purposes; tight
